project.name: Gentoo PPC64
project.description: The PPC64 Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the PowerPC64 architecture.

longdescription.p: This project is dedicated to running Gentoo on PowerPC64 systems. These systems encompass IBM RS/6000s, Power Macintosh G5 systems, IBM pSeries and soon IBM iSeries boxen.

body.p: As a project, we're about a year old now. There are a number of packages not marked stable yet but over time we're improving. Gnome is starting to get close and kde is there. Hopefully this is useful and if you like please join us on irc.freenode.net #gentoo-ppc64.
nigoro, corsair and tgall held a meeting on 01/01/2005 to discuss future items they intend to focus on. The list is:

ul.li: mozilla -- tgall_foo to check in nss fixes
newer xorg support -- corsair / nigoro / tgall
mga accel support in xorg -- tgall_foo
d.g.o/~tgall -> ppc64.gentoo.org -- corsair (done as you can see)

body.p: The 2005.0 release was also discussed. Look for lots of good things in the next few weeks.
There are experimental 2005.0 stages available at this location: http://www.unixforces.net/ppc64/2005.0/stages/
Latest Live CD for PowerMacs is available here: Live CD. It adds support for the new iMac G5.
Latest Live CD for pSeries is available here: Live CD. This CD is equivalent to the CD found on the mirrors.
Just follow the PPC64 handbook. If you get stuck join us on irc.freenode.org #gentoo-ppc64 or open a bugreport at bugs.gentoo.org.

As with all Open Source projects, volunteers are at the core of makinga it all happen! Even if you only have an hour or two here or there or you don't know how to code, that's perfectly ok. There are many aspects of an open source project and your talents certainly can advance if not be critical to the project!
This project could not have been possible without the support and assistance of others. Specifically I'd like to mention:
